metadata.synopsis: He may be blind, but Nick Parker (Rutger Hauer) has a way with a sword. The Vietnam vet pays a visit to an old war buddy, Frank Deveraux (Terrance O'Quinn), only to discover that his friend is in deep trouble. Gangsters have killed Frank's wife (Meg Foster) and are holding him hostage in Reno, Nev. Making a narrow escape with Frank's young son (Brandon Call), Nick heads across the country to even the score. Needless to say, his opponents underestimate him -- and his sword skills.

reviews: This did provide Rutger Hauer with perhaps his most unusual heroic role until Hobo with a Shotgun 22 years later.
Stranger danger! Just because Rutger Hauer says he's blind doesn't mean you should let him put his paws all over your annoying kid's face.
A satisfying action vehicle for Hauer...

the unacknowledged adaptation of the Zato Ichi films, which features Rutger Hauer as a blind swordsman who wanders the roads of America, helps reunite a small boy with his father, and wastes more mob henchman than you can shake a white cane at.
Cool fight scenes that play up the blind aspect. Not much of a story, but a fun action movie.
Solid B-level actioner with lots of mayhem and the great Rutger Hauer.
